“I think we need to be ashamed” and “Everything we’ve done”: Richard Gabriel talk at the Software Development Forum, Palo Alto, California, January 23, 2003.

“艺术意味着某种设计出来的东西”和“我工作的主要目标”：Donald Knuth，“计算机编程作为一门艺术”，1974 年图灵奖演讲，发表于ACM 通讯， 1974 年 12 月。

“art meant something devised” and “The chief goal of my work”: Donald Knuth, “Computer Programming as an Art,” 1974 Turing Award lecture, in Communications of the ACM, December 1974.

“无法忍受写书”：Donald Knuth 在 Steve Ditlea 中引用，“用 0 和 1 重写圣经”，技术评论， 1999 年 9 月至 10 月。

“couldn’t stand to write books”: Donald Knuth quoted in Steve Ditlea, “Rewriting the Bible in 0’s and 1’s,” Technology Review, September–October1999.

“谨防上述代码中的错误”：Knuth 在 http://www-cs-faculty.stanford.edu/~knuth/faq.htm 上解释了这句话被多次引用的引用的确切来源。

“Beware of bugs in the above code”: Knuth explains the exact origins of the much-cited quote at http://www-cs-faculty.stanford.edu/~knuth/faq.htm.

“我学到了什么”：Donald Knuth，计算机科学论文精选（CSLI Publicational/剑桥大学出版社，1996 年），第 14 页。161.

“What were the lessons I learned”: Donald Knuth, Selected Papers on Computer Science (CSLI Publicational/Cambridge University Press, 1996), p. 161.

“需要更长的注意力”：同上，第 17 页。145.

“A longer attention span is needed”: Ibid., p. 145.

关于 Knuth 入口处的 Piet Hein 诗的信息来自《技术评论》中 Ditlea 的“重写圣经” 。

The information about the Piet Hein poem over Knuth’s entrance is from Ditlea, “Rewriting the Bible,” in Technology Review.

“而不是想象我们的主要任务”：来自 Donald Knuth，“文学编程 (1984)”，《文学编程》，语言和信息研究中心，1992 年，第 17 页。99，如 http://www.literateprogramming.com/ 所引用。

“Instead of imagining that our main task”: From Donald Knuth, “Literate Programming (1984)” in Literate Programming, Center for the Study of Language and Information, 1992, p. 99, as cited at http://www.literateprogramming.com/.

“Linux 内核脏话”网站位于 http://www.vidarholen.net/contents/wordcount/。

The “Linux kernel swear words” site is at http://www.vidarholen.net/contents/wordcount/.

MyDoom、Bagle 和 Netsky 病毒作者的评论报告于 Iain Thomson，“Virus Writers Stage Online Slanging Match”，Vnunet.com，2004 年 3 月 3 日，网址：http://www.vnunet.com/vnunet /news/2124482/virus-writers-stage-online-slanging-match。

The comments by the authors of the MyDoom, Bagle, and Netsky viruses are reported in Iain Thomson, “Virus Writers Stage Online Slanging Match,” Vnunet.com, March 3, 2004, at http://www.vnunet.com/vnunet/news/2124482/virus-writers-stage-online-slanging-match.

Windows 2000 源代码注释在“We Are Morons: A Quick Look at the Win2k Source”中报道，Kuro5hin，2004 年 2 月 16 日，网址：http://www.kuro5hin.org/story/2004/2/15/71552 /7795。

The Windows 2000 source code comments were reported in “We Are Morons: A Quick Look at the Win2k Source,” Kuro5hin, February 16, 2004, at http://www.kuro5hin.org/story/2004/2/15/71552/7795.

第11章

CHAPTER 11

狗粮之路

THE ROAD TO DOGFOOD

“在任何大型软件中都保持高效”：Jaron Lanier 引用 Janice Hess 的“从头开始编码”，Sun Developer Network，2003 年 1 月 23 日，网址：http://java.sun.com/features/2003/01/lanier_qa1 .htm。

“To be effective at any large software”: Jaron Lanier quoted in Janice Hess, “Coding from Scratch,” Sun Developer Network, January 23, 2003, at http://java.sun.com/features/2003/01/lanier_qa1.htm.

Ted Leung 于 2004 年 10 月 4 日发表的寻找“热门 Python 黑客”的博客文章位于 http://www.sauria.com/blog/2004/Oct/04。

Ted Leung’s blog posting looking for a “hot shot Python hacker,” October 4, 2004, is at http://www.sauria.com/blog/2004/Oct/04.

“我最近在查看源代码”：Phillip J. Eby，“Python Is Not Java”，2004 年 12 月 2 日发表的博客文章，网址为 http://dirtsimple.org/2004/12/python-is-not-java .htm。

“I was recently looking at the source”: Phillip J. Eby, “Python Is Not Java,” blog posting on December 2, 2004, at http://dirtsimple.org/2004/12/python-is-not-java.htm.

“这简直就是一件美丽的事情”：Phillip Eby 于 2005 年 2 月 15 日发表的博客文章，网址为：http://dirtsimple.org/2005/02/making-it-from-scratch-withtdd-and.htm。

“It is quite simply a thing of beauty”: Phillip Eby blog posting from February 15, 2005, at http://dirtsimple.org/2005/02/making-it-from-scratch-withtdd-and.htm.

钱德勒的线路计数由 OSAF 实习生 Brendan O'Connor 和 Arel Cordero 进行。

The line counts for Chandler were made by OSAF interns Brendan O’Connor and Arel Cordero.

将加入钱德勒比作“搬到新城市”的实习生是阿雷尔·科德罗 (Arel Cordero)。

The intern who compared joining Chandler to “moving to a new city” was Arel Cordero.

“虽然不能排除这种可能性”：Ellen Spertus，“为什么女性计算机科学家这么少？” 麻省理工学院人工智能实验室技术报告 1315，1991 年 8 月，网址：http://people.mills.edu/spertus/Gender/pap/pap.htm。最近的更新“我们可以从计算机科学与其他科学的差异中学到什么”位于http://www.barnard.columbia.edu/bcrw/womenand

work/spertus.htm。

“While one cannot rule out the possibility”: Ellen Spertus, “Why Are There So Few Female Computer Scientists?” MIT Artificial Intelligence Laboratory Technical Report 1315, August 1991, at http://people.mills.edu/spertus/Gender/pap/pap.htm. A more recent update, “What We Can Learn from Computer Science’s Differences from other Sciences,” is at http://www.barnard.columbia.edu/bcrw/womenand

work/spertus.htm.

“这就是编程的整个世界”：Alan Kay 对 Lisp 的讨论参见“与 Alan Kay 的对话”，ACM Queue， 2004 年 12 月至 2005 年 1 月，网址：http://acmqueue.com/modules.php?name=Content&pa =显示页面& pid=273。

“This is the whole world of programming”: Alan Kay’s discussion of Lisp is in “A Conversation with Alan Kay,” ACM Queue, December 2004–January 2005, at http://acmqueue.com/modules.php?name=Content&pa=showpage& pid=273.

道格拉斯·霍夫施塔特、哥德尔、埃舍尔、巴赫：永恒的金辫子（Basic，1979）。

Douglas Hofstadter, Gödel, Escher, Bach: An Eternal Golden Braid (Basic, 1979).

“任何递归函数都会导致”：来自 Colin Allen 和 Maneesh Dhagat，LISP Primer，网址为 http://grimpeur.tamu.edu/~colin/lp/node31.htm。我对停机问题的讨论要归功于 David Harel 在他的书《Computers Ltd.: What TheyReally Can't Do》（牛津，2000 年）中的清晰解释。

“Any recursive function will cause”: From Colin Allen and Maneesh Dhagat, LISP Primer, at http://grimpeur.tamu.edu/~colin/lp/node31.htm. My discussion of the halting problem is indebted to David Harel’s lucid explanations in his book Computers Ltd.: What They Really Can’t Do (Oxford, 2000).

“尝试解决问题是很诱人的”：David Harel，Computers Ltd.，第 14 页。53.

“It is tempting to try and solve the problem”: David Harel, Computers Ltd., p. 53.

“我们对软件系统的希望破灭了”：同上，第 17 页。50.

“dashes our hope for a software system”: Ibid., p. 50.

霍夫施塔特定律出现在第 17 页。他的书《哥德尔、埃舍尔、巴赫》第 152 页。

Hofstadter’s Law appears on p. 152 of his book, Gödel, Escher, Bach.

“当人们问我什么时候”：理查德·斯托曼 (Richard Stallman)，引用于保罗·琼斯 (Paul Jones) 的《布鲁克斯定律和开源：越多越好？》IBM Developer Works，2000 年 5 月 1 日，网址：http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/linux/library/os-merrier.htm

。

“When people ask me when”: Richard Stallman, quoted in Paul Jones, “Brooks’ Law and Open Source: The More the Merrier?” IBM Developer Works, May 1, 2000, at http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/linux/

library/os-merrier.htm.

Kapor 的博客文章介绍了基于 Web 的软件的新力量：“当浏览器成长时”，2005 年 1 月 2 日，网址：http://blogs.osafoundation.org/mitch/000812.htm#000812

。

Kapor’s blog posting on the new power of Web-based software: “When Browsers Grow Up,” January 2, 2005, at http://blogs.osafoundation.org/mitch/

000812.htm#000812.

Jon Udell 在日历“火车残骸”上发布的帖子位于 http://weblog.infoworld.com/udell/2004/12/09.htm

#a1130。

Jon Udell’s posting on the calendaring “train wreck” is at http://weblog.infoworld.com/udell/2004/12/09.htm

#a1130.

Scott Mace 的 Calendar Swamp 博客位于 http://calendarswamp.blogspot.com/。

Scott Mace’s Calendar Swamp blog is at http://calendarswamp.blogspot.com/.

“我遇到了一些崩溃”：Philippe Bossut 于 2005 年 10 月 3 日发表的有关对 Chandler 进行测试的博客文章位于 http://wp.osafoundation.org/2005/10/03/dogfooding-chandler/。

“I ran through a couple of crashers”: Philippe Bossut’s blog posting about dogfooding Chandler, from October 3, 2005, is at http://wp.osafoundation.org/2005/10/03/dogfooding-chandler/.

“软件开发缺乏一个关键要素”：Alan Cooper，《The Inmates Are Running the Asylum》（SAMS，1999），第 14 页。41.

“Software development lacks one key element”: Alan Cooper, The Inmates Are Running the Asylum (SAMS, 1999), p. 41.

“因为软件是免费的”：Linus Torvalds，引自 Robert Cringely，“Microsoft 对开源的误解如何伤害我们所有人”，2003 年 10 月 23 日，网址：http://www.pbs.org/cringely/pulpit/pulpit20031023。嗯。

“Because the software is free”: Linus Torvalds, quoted in Robert Cringely, “How Microsoft’s Misunderstanding of Open Source Hurts Us All,” October 23, 2003, at http://www.pbs.org/cringely/pulpit/pulpit20031023.htm.

Firefox 市场份额信息定期在 http://www.spreadfirefox.com/ 上报告。

Firefox market share information is reported regularly at http://www.spreadfirefox.com/.

结语

EPILOGUE

长期赌注

A LONG BET

加州媒体广泛报道了海湾大桥的延误；例如，约翰·金（John King），“重大问题：它最终会建成吗？” 《旧金山纪事报》， 2006 年 3 月 21 日，网址：http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/c/a/2006/03/21/MNGD8HRJ761.DTL。

The Bay Bridge delays were widely covered in the California press; for example, John King, “Towering Question: Will It Finally Be Built?” San Francisco Chronicle, March 21, 2006, at http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/c/a/2006/03/21/MNGD8HRJ761.DTL.

“构建软件的难点”：Frederick Brooks，“No Silver Bullet: Essence and Accidents of Software Engineering”，Computer 20:4（1987 年 4 月），第 10-19 页。

“the hard thing about building software”: Frederick Brooks, “No Silver Bullet: Essence and Accidents of Software Engineering,” Computer 20:4 (April1987), pp. 10–19.

“机器将变得越来越多”：Freeman Dyson 在 2004 年 7 月于俄勒冈州波特兰举行的 O'Reilly 开源大会上发表讲话。音频可在 http://www.itconversations.com/shows/detail170.htm 上获取。

“The machines will become more and more”: Freeman Dyson spoke at the O’Reilly Open Source Conference, Portland, Oregon, July 2004. Audio is available at http://www.itconversations.com/shows/detail170.htm.

“最终，信息系统只会给予”：Jaron Lanier 在 OOPSLA 2004 会议上。

“Ultimately, information systems only give”: Jaron Lanier at OOPSLA 2004 Conference.

比尔·盖茨在新加坡：Rohan Sullivan，“盖茨说技术有一天会允许计算机植入，但硬连线不适合他”，美联社，2005 年 7 月 5 日。存档于 http://www.interesting-people.org/archives/有趣的人/200507/msg00029.htm。

Bill Gates in Singapore: Rohan Sullivan, “Gates Says Technology Will One Day Allow Computer Implants—but Hardwiring’s Not for Him,” Associated Press, July 5, 2005. Archived at http://www.interesting-people.org/archives/interesting-people/200507/msg00029.htm.

“从世界的混乱中解脱出来”：Ellen Ullman，《The Bug》（Nan A. Talese/Doubleday，2003），第 17 页。9.

“relief from the confusions of the world”: Ellen Ullman, The Bug (Nan A. Talese/Doubleday, 2003), p. 9.

卡普尔 (Kapor) 与雷·库兹韦尔 (Ray Kurzweil) 的长期赌注记录在 http://www.longbets.org/1 上。

Kapor’s Long Bet with Ray Kurzweil is chronicled at http://www.longbets.org/1.

“现实的彻底转变”：库兹韦尔在 2005 年 9 月 23 日旧金山 Long Now 基金会主办的一次演讲中描述了他对奇点的看法。该活动的视频位于 http://video.google.com/video播放？docid=610691660251309257。

“radical transformation of the reality”: Kurzweil described his vision of the Singularity in a talk hosted by the Long Now Foundation, San Francisco, September 23, 2005. Video of the event is at http://video.google.com/video play?docid=610691660251309257.

“在短期内，我们总是低估”：Kurzweil，Long Now 基金会的演讲。

“in the short term we always underestimate”: Kurzweil, Long Now Foundation talk.

“作为人类：我们是具体的。”：卡普尔的长赌注附带文章位于 http://www.longbets.org/1。

“As humans: We are embodied.”: Kapor’s essay accompanying the Long Bet is at http://www.longbets.org/1.

致谢

ACKNOWLEDGMENTS

如果没有米奇·卡普尔愿意向我打开钱德勒项目的大门，这本书就不可能写成。当他第一次这么做的时候，我们谁也没想到我会坚持这么久，或者最终记录下这么多的延误和挫折。如果他曾经想过以这种方式曝光他团队的工作，那么在我在 OSAF 的这些年里，他一次也没有提起过。“这是开源方式，”我知道他会说。

This book could not have been written without Mitch Kapor’s willingness to open the Chandler project’s doors to me. At the time he first did so, neither of us expected that I would stick around as long as I did, or end up chronicling so many delays and setbacks. If he ever had second thoughts about exposing his team’s work in this fashion, not once in the years I spent at OSAF did he bring them up. “It’s the open source way,” I know he would say.

为此，我深表感谢，就像我感谢 OSAF 的所有程序员和其他员工一样，他们欢迎我，并多年来花时间回答我关于他们的工作和他们自己的问题。以下人员参加了长时间采访：John Anderson、Philippe Bossut、Donn Denman、Lisa Dusseault、Andy Hertzfeld、Mitch Kapor、Chao Lam、Ted Leung、Rys McCusker（通过电子邮件）、Lou Montulli、Sheila Mooney、Katie Parlante、Stuart Parmenter 、摩根·萨根、布莱恩·斯金纳、迈克尔·托伊、安迪·瓦伊达和米米·尹。许多其他人在午餐时、会议室或办公桌上非正式地分享了他们的想法和见解。

For that I am deeply grateful, as I am to all the programmers and other staff at OSAF who welcomed me and took the time over the years to answer my questions about their work and themselves. The following people sat for extended interviews: John Anderson, Philippe Bossut, Donn Denman, Lisa Dusseault, Andy Hertzfeld, Mitch Kapor, Chao Lam, Ted Leung, Rys McCusker (via email), Lou Montulli, Sheila Mooney, Katie Parlante, Stuart Parmenter, Morgen Sagen, Brian Skinner, Michael Toy, Andi Vajda, and Mimi Yin. Many others shared their ideas and insights informally over lunch, in meeting rooms, or at their desks.

我也感谢过去十年中众多程序员和技术专家选择在网上公开、坦诚地撰写他们的工作。他们的工作使我的工作成为可能。我发现其中一些人的写作和博客特别有帮助或相关，包括 Dan Bricklin、Grady Booch、Adam Bosworth、Tim Bray、Geoff Cohen、Paul Ford、Martin Fowler、Paul Graham、David Heinemeyer Hansson、Robert Lefkowitz、Eric Sink、Joel Spolsky 、乔恩·乌德尔、戴夫·维纳和杰里米·扎沃德尼。感谢他们和许多其他人的工作，我相信未来几十年回顾我们的时代将是文艺复兴时期程序员作家的黄金时代。

I’m grateful, too, to the legions of programmers and technologists who have chosen, over the past decade, to write publicly and candidly about their work online. Their work has made mine possible. Some of those whose writing and blogging I found especially helpful or relevant are Dan Bricklin, Grady Booch, Adam Bosworth, Tim Bray, Geoff Cohen, Paul Ford, Martin Fowler, Paul Graham, David Heinemeyer Hansson, Robert Lefkowitz, Eric Sink, Joel Spolsky, Jon Udell, Dave Winer, and Jeremy Zawodny. Thanks to their work and that of many others, I’m convinced that future decades will look back on our time as a sort of golden age of Renaissance programmer-writers.

我还要感谢 Salon.com 的所有同事，特别是 David Talbot，他给了我继续这个项目的机会，还要感谢 Joan Walsh，她在项目完成后欢迎我回来。我对编程的大部分思考都是通过多年来与我的朋友兼同事安德鲁·伦纳德 (Andrew Leonard) 的对话和合作获得的。在过去的十年中，我从沙龙技术部门的每个同事那里学到了宝贵的经验教训，特别是查德·迪克森（Chad Dickerson），他在这个项目上给了我早期的鼓励。

I also owe a debt of thanks to all my colleagues at Salon.com—in particular, to David Talbot, who gave me the opportunity to pursue this project, and to Joan Walsh, who welcomed me back once it was finished. Much of my thinking about programming has been informed by conversations and collaborations over the years with my friend and colleague Andrew Leonard. During the past decade, I’ve learned valuable lessons from everyone I’ve worked with in Salon’s technology department, especially Chad Dickerson, who gave me early encouragement on this project.

有一天，我希望能够准确地了解到我的代理人斯图尔特·克里切夫斯基 (Stuart Krichevsky) 是如何熟练地身兼多职——作为倡导者、外交官和顾问；他的不懈努力使我在每个阶段都变得更加轻松。还要感谢他的员工 Shana Cohen 和 Elizabeth Kellermeyer。我在皇冠的编辑雷切尔·克莱曼（Rachel Klayman）热情地接受了我的想法，大力支持它们，并用明智而聪明的手帮助磨平了它们的粗糙边缘。我还要感谢帮助本书走向世界的 Crown 团队的其他成员：Lucinda Bartley、Patricia Bozza、Tina Constable、Whitney Cookman、Maria Elias、Kristin Kiser、Donna Passannante、Philip Patrick、Steve Ross、Penny西蒙和杨杰。

Someday I hope to learn exactly how my agent, Stuart Krichevsky, wears his multiple hats—as advocate, diplomat, and adviser—so skillfully; his tireless efforts made mine easier at every stage. Thanks also to his staff, Shana Cohen and Elizabeth Kellermeyer. My editor at Crown, Rachel Klayman, embraced my ideas enthusiastically, championed them vigorously, and helped smooth their rough edges with a judicious and fiercely intelligent hand. I would also like to thank the rest of the team at Crown that helped launch this book into the world: Lucinda Bartley, Patricia Bozza, Tina Constable, Whitney Cookman, Maria Elias, Kristin Kiser, Donna Passannante, Philip Patrick, Steve Ross, Penny Simon, and Jie Yang.

苏·哈尔彭 (Sue Halpern) 帮助我完善了我的图书提案，非常感谢。David Edelstein、Josh Kornbluth 和 Bill McKibben 阅读了本书的早期版本，并提供了很多深思熟虑的反馈。Rafe Colburn 和 Mike Pence，既是程序员又是作家，阅读了我的手稿，并帮助我确保我没有陷入技术困境。OSAF 的 Heikki Toivonen 也提供了宝贵的评论和更正。

Sue Halpern helped me sharpen my book proposal, for which much thanks. David Edelstein, Josh Kornbluth, and Bill McKibben read early versions of the book and provided much thoughtful feedback. Rafe Colburn and Mike Pence, programmers and writers both, read my manuscript and helped me make sure I wasn’t driving into some technical ditch. Heikki Toivonen at OSAF also provided valuable comments and corrections.

大多数作者感谢他们的家人；现在我知道为什么了。我的妻子戴娜·梅西 (Dayna Macy) 是我每一章的第一位读者，她引导我的工作变得更加清晰。每当前进的道路似乎迷失或受阻时，她的鼓励和洞察力让我走上正轨。她的精神使我精神振奋；她的支持和爱使一切成为可能。

Most authors thank their families; now I know why. My wife, Dayna Macy, was the first reader for each of my chapters and guided my work toward clarity. Her encouragement and insights kept me on track each time the way forward seemed lost or blocked; her spirits kept mine aloft; her support and love made everything else possible.

我的儿子马修和杰克善意地接受了这个项目对他们认为属于他们的时间的侵入。他们还揭示了乐高假说的奥秘。

My sons, Matthew and Jack, good-naturedly accepted this project’s incursions into time they believed belong to them. They also shed light on the mysteries of the Lego Hypothesis.

我的兄弟保罗·罗（Paul Rowe）从小就为我树立了雄辩和优雅的书面表达的榜样。（他还好心地安排我去纽约旅行。）

My brother, Paul Rowe, set an example for me from childhood of eloquence and grace in written expression. (He also kindly put me up on my trips to New York.)

在我十几岁的时候，我的父母珍妮·罗森伯格和科尔曼·罗森伯格——他们无疑更愿意看到我从事细胞生物学等方面的研究——在“计算机就是未来”的理论下，他们全权让我修改游戏程序。我认为他们在这一点上仍然是对的。谨以此书献给他们，感谢他们的慷慨和奉献，以及我的爱。

During my teens, my parents, Jeanne and Coleman Rosenberg—who doubtless would have preferred to see me pursue, say, cellular biology—gave me carte blanche to tinker with game programs, under the theory that “computers are the future.” I think they’re still right about that. This book is dedicated to them, with my gratitude for all their generosity and devotion, and my love.

关于作者

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Scott Rosenberg 是Salon.com的联合创始人，曾担任 Salon.com 的技术编辑，然后担任总编辑，现在担任负责新项目的副总裁。在沙龙之前，他为《旧金山观察报》撰写有关戏剧、电影和技术的文章，并因其评论而荣获乔治·让·内森奖。他的作品曾发表在《纽约时报》、《连线》和许多其他出版物上。他与妻子和两个儿子住在加利福尼亚州伯克利。

Scott Rosenberg is cofounder of Salon.com, where he served as technology editor, then managing editor, and is now vice president for new projects. Before Salon he wrote on theater, movies, and technology for the San Francisco Examiner and was honored with the George Jean Nathan Award for his reviews. His writing has appeared in the New York Times, Wired, and many other publications. He lives in Berkeley, California, with his wife and two sons.

请访问他的网站：www.wordyard.com。本书的网站位于www.dreamingincode.com。

Visit his Web site at www.wordyard.com. This book’s Web site is at www.dreamingincode.com.
